intro: Comandra livida, commonly known as the slender comandra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Comandra livida is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant, making it a resilient species in its native range.
